Review Text: This was an excellent epic. Somewhat typical in regard to characters and action scenes, but this is a Chinese epic story of subterfuge and individual ability conquering a much larger and better equipped army. Very little fantasy as in Crouching tiger, but this is as much about strategy and tactics as swordplay. The plot is taken from an actual historical event with little embellishment.
Review Title: Worth having to endure subtitles
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2014/03/20
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Gary A. Randall', 'Eric Laneuville', 'Kelly Makin', 'Jonathan Frakes', 'Randy Zisk', 'Timothy Busfield', 'Jeff Bleckner', 'Lee Rose', 'Ron Underwood', 'Tricia Brock'], 'Studio': ['FOX']}
Review Text: This is an excellent crime drama. Interesting story lines, with believable characters. The eye candy ain't bad, either. The conclusion of each episode usually brings a surprise arrest. Just as in real law enforcement, there are few shootouts. This is more cerebral, with good attention to detail. The errors are few, and only someone in law enforcement or the legal profession would catch them. I can't imagine why some exec would pull the plug on a series that had more viewers than CNN. And, A&E isn't talking.
Review Title: Whoever decided to end this series should be fired.
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

Review Text: Although the premise is unrealistic, the casting and plot lines make the it worth watching. Like "The Glades", I don't know why it only ran two seasons.

For example. no one I know would put their hands on someone in the interview room.  The only reason I gave it four stars, as opposed to five is the social commentary included in most episodes.  I also bet that NYC wishes they could find a commish like Selleck's character.

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The analysis of the purchase history reveals a strong preference for high-quality crime drama and action shows, often characterized by engaging, cerebral narratives and strong character development. The individual displays consistent positive sentiment, with frequent ratings above 4.5, indicating a discerning taste for entertainment that balances realism and entertainment value.

Common themes in the purchase data include an attraction to works featuring violence and moral complexity, with a specific interest in storylines grounded in reality, such as historical events or law enforcement scenarios. There is a clear appreciation for originality and high production values, as evidenced by mentions of special effects and casting.

This individual shows a tolerance for subtitled content, reflecting a willingness to engage with diverse narratives, particularly those from different cultural contexts. However, there is a noted decline in rating when social commentary is overly prominent, suggesting a preference for entertainment that avoids preachiness.

Quality preferences lean towards superior cinematography and effective storytelling rather than mere star power, indicating a willingness to overlook less known actors if the material is strong. While pricing details aren't directly addressed, the individual's consistent positive ratings imply a willingness to invest in quality at reasonable price points, underscoring a balanced approach to cost vs. value in entertainment choices.

target_interaction.title: Excellent special effects graphics
target_interaction.text: Excellent special effects graphics. Good story arcs and cast. Never read the book, but this might be worth a trip to the library.
